intro: Alyssum maritimum var. canariense, commonly known as Canary Island Alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in coastal and rocky environments.
